In this lesson, we will be focusing on the basic sentence structure in Japanese encompassing subjects, objects, and verbs. As a reminder, Japanese sentence structure differs from English in that the verb generally comes at the end of the sentence.
So let's begin. In English, we would say "I eat apples", where "I" is the subject, "eat" is the verb, and "apples" is the object. In Japanese, this sentence would be organized as "I apples eat". The wording might seem odd now, but with practice it will become second nature.
